organization.address: 1820 Jet Stream Drive; Colorado Springs, CO 80921

translations.name: I' Utz Laj Tzij Re I Dios
IBS Version
translations.description: Under the Bible Society of Ethiopia (a member of the United Bible Societies), a new translation was printed in 1987, translated directly from Hebrew and Greek. A revised version of this appeared in 2005. These versions contain only the 66 books of the Protestant canon, and they have not been widely embraced by the Ethiopian Orthodox Tewahedo Church. Living Bibles International produced a New Testament in 1985. Following the 1992 merger of LBI with IBS, the International Bible Society produced a complete Bible in 2001. This is a translation from the English NIV, or is at least very heavily reliant upon it.

translations.name: New Amharic Standard Version
translations.description: Living Bibles International, merged with International Bible Society and now called Biblica, produced a New Testament in 1985. Biblica produced a complete Bible in 2001. This is a translation from the English NIV, or is at least very heavily reliant upon it.

translations.name: መጽሐፍ ቅዱስ፥ አዲሱ መደበኛ ትርጒም
translations.description: Living Bibles International, merged with International Bible Society and now called Biblica, produced a New Testament in 1985. Biblica produced a complete Bible in 2001. This is a translation from the English NIV, or is at least very heavily reliant upon it.

translations.name: Arabic Book of Life
translations.description: The Arabic Bible Book of Life is a Modern Standard Arabic translation of the Bible. Arab theologians and linguists began working on the translation in 1973 and the New Testament was published 1982, the full Bible following in 1988. Over the years the Book of Life has evolved from a translation of the printed Bible to a ministry aiming at communicating the Bible in various media to diverse audiences.

translations.name: كتاب الحياة
translations.description: The Arabic Bible Book of Life is a Modern Standard Arabic translation of the Bible. Arab theologians and linguists began working on the translation in 1973 and the New Testament was published 1982, the full Bible following in 1988. Over the years the Book of Life has evolved from a translation of the printed Bible to a ministry aiming at communicating the Bible in various media to diverse audiences.

translations.name: Word on the Road Bible
translations.description:
This Biblica translation of the New Testament is for the Czech language; an estimated 12 million people speak Czech as their mother tongue. This translation uses an informal language style and applies a meaning-based translation philosophy. It was translated from the biblical languages and is targeted for a general audience. It was completed in 1988.
Copyright © 1988, 2000 by Biblica, Inc.® Used by permission. All rights reserved worldwide.

translations.name: The New Testament in Eastern Cakchiquel
Ri Dios Nch'o Pa Kach'abül Cheke
Chinese Living Bible
translations.description: The Chinese New Living Translation is a dynamic equivalent Chinese New Testament translation published in paperback in Hong Kong by Chinese Bible International in 2004 and revised in 2006. The base text is the English New Living Translation with comparison with the Greek originals.

translations.name: 当代圣经
translations.description: The Chinese New Living Translation is a dynamic equivalent Chinese New Testament translation published in paperback in Hong Kong by Chinese Bible International in 2004 and revised in 2006. The base text is the English New Living Translation with comparison with the Greek originals.

translations.name: Revised Chinese Union Version
translations.description: The Revised Union Version is a revision for the CUV, the Revised Chinese Union Version (RCUV) which was completed for the New Testament in 2006, and for the entire Bible in 2010. The 100-year-old CUV becomes harder to digest as the Chinese language experiences changes over time, thus the importance of the Revised CUV whose express purpose is to enhance the spread of the gospel and encourage believers to read the Bible. The Hong Kong Bible Society has devoted 30 years to revising the CUV and published the Revised Chinese Union Version (RCUV) in 2010.

translations.name: 修訂版和合本
translations.description: The Revised Union Version is a revision for the CUV, the Revised Chinese Union Version (RCUV) which was completed for the New Testament in 2006, and for the entire Bible in 2010. The 100-year-old CUV becomes harder to digest as the Chinese language experiences changes over time, thus the importance of the Revised CUV whose express purpose is to enhance the spread of the gospel and encourage believers to read the Bible. The Hong Kong Bible Society has devoted 30 years to revising the CUV and published the Revised Chinese Union Version (RCUV) in 2010.

translations.name: Chinese Contemporary Bible
translations.description: The Chinese Contemporary Bible is a translation of the Bible into Chinese from the Greek and Hebrew performed by the International Bible Society in Colorado Springs, Colorado, and published in 2012. It was intended to replace the Chinese Living Bible. Its New Testament (originally published in 1974) by Living Bibles International, then republished in 1998 by IBS.

translations.name: 当代译本
translations.description: The Chinese Contemporary Bible is a translation of the Bible into Chinese from the Greek and Hebrew performed by the International Bible Society in Colorado Springs, Colorado, and published in 2012. It was intended to replace the Chinese Living Bible. Its New Testament (originally published in 1974) by Living Bibles International, then republished in 1998 by IBS.

publishedBibles.copyright: The Worldwide Bible Society, Lockman Foundation

translations.name: Chinese Union Version (Simplified)
translations.description: The Chinese Union Version (CUV) is well known Chinese language Bible, translated by a panel representing many Protestant denominations. The panel used the English Revised Version validating against original manuscripts. Work on the CUV began in 1890 and was completed in 1919. This edition uses simplified Chinese characters which are used mainly in the People’s Republic of China (Mainland China) and Singapore.

translations.name: 和合本
translations.description: The Chinese Union Version (CUV) is well known Chinese language Bible, translated by a panel representing many Protestant denominations. The panel used the English Revised Version validating against original manuscripts. Work on the CUV began in 1890 and was completed in 1919. This edition uses simplified Chinese characters which are used mainly in the People’s Republic of China (Mainland China) and Singapore.

translations.name: Chinese Union Version (Traditional)
translations.description: The Chinese Union Version (CUV) is well known Chinese language Bible, translated by a panel representing many Protestant denominations. The panel used the English Revised Version validating against original manuscripts. Work on the CUV began in 1890 and was completed in 1919. This edition uses traditional Chinese characters which are more common in the Republic of China (Taiwan), Hong Kong and Macau.

translations.name: 和合本

translations.name: Hope For All
translations.description: The Bible translation Hope for All (abbreviated HFA) is a dynamic equivalence translation of the Bible by Biblica in 2002 and distributed by Fontis-Verlag. The HFAA is one of the most successful contemporary German Bible translations. It has sold more than 1.3 million copies.

translations.name: Hoffnung für Alle
translations.description: The Bible translation Hope for All (abbreviated HFA) is a dynamic equivalence translation of the Bible by Biblica in 2002 and distributed by Fontis-Verlag. The HFAA is one of the most successful contemporary German Bible translations. It has sold more than 1.3 million copies.

publishedBibles.derived: Revision of the American Standard Version

translations.name: Amplified Bible
translations.description: The Amplified Bible was the first Bible project of The Lockman Foundation. It attempts to take both word meaning and context into account in order to accurately translate the original text from one language into another. The Amplified Bible does this through the use of explanatory alternate readings and amplifications to assist the reader in understanding what Scripture really says. Multiple English word equivalents to each key Hebrew and Greek word clarify and amplify meanings that may otherwise have been concealed by the traditional translation method. The Amplified Bible present on the Bible Gateway matches the 1987 printing.

translations.name: Amplified Bible
translations.description: The Amplified Bible was the first Bible project of The Lockman Foundation. It attempts to take both word meaning and context into account in order to accurately translate the original text from one language into another. The Amplified Bible does this through the use of explanatory alternate readings and amplifications to assist the reader in understanding what Scripture really says. Multiple English word equivalents to each key Hebrew and Greek word clarify and amplify meanings that may otherwise have been concealed by the traditional translation method. The Amplified Bible present on the Bible Gateway matches the 1987 printing.

translations.name: King James Version
translations.description: The King James Version, commonly known as the Authorized Version or King James Bible, is an English translation of the Christian Bible for the Church of England begun in 1604 and completed in 1611.

translations.name: King James Version
translations.description: The King James Version, commonly known as the Authorized Version or King James Bible, is an English translation of the Christian Bible for the Church of England begun in 1604 and completed in 1611.

translations.name: The Message
translations.description: The goal of The Message is to engage people in the reading process and help them understand what they read. This is not a study Bible, but rather \\\"a reading Bible.\\\" The verse numbers, which are not in the original documents, have been left out of the print version to facilitate easy and enjoyable reading. The original books of the Bible were not written in formal language. The Message tries to recapture the Word in the words we use today. Copyright © 1993, 1994, 1995, 1996, 2000, 2001, 2002. Used by permission of NavPress Publishing Group.\\\"

translations.name: The Message
translations.description: The goal of The Message is to engage people in the reading process and help them understand what they read. This is not a study Bible, but rather \\\"a reading Bible.\\\" The verse numbers, which are not in the original documents, have been left out of the print version to facilitate easy and enjoyable reading. The original books of the Bible were not written in formal language. The Message tries to recapture the Word in the words we use today. Copyright © 1993, 1994, 1995, 1996, 2000, 2001, 2002. Used by permission of NavPress Publishing Group.\\\"

translations.name: New American Standard Bible
translations.description: This new edition is a thorough revision of the already excellent New American BibleOld Testament of 1970. Work on most books of the Old Testament, begun in 1994 and completed in 2001, was done by forty revisers and a board of eight editors. The 1991 revision of the Psalter, the work of thirty revisers and six editors, was further revised by seven revisers and two editors between 2009 and 2010. As suggested in the comments above, the revision aimed at making use of the best manuscript traditions available (see below), translating as accurately as possible, and rendering the result in good contemporary English. In many ways it is a more literal translation than the original NAB and has attempted to be more consistent in rendering Hebrew (or Greek) words and idioms, especially in technical contexts, such as regulations for sacrifices. In translating the Psalter special effort was made to provide a smooth, rhythmic translation for easy singing or recitation, and to retain the concrete imagery of the Hebrew.

translations.name: New International Reader's Version
translations.description: Biblica (formerly International Bible Society) provides God’s Word to people through translation, publishing and Bible engagement in Africa, Asia Pacific, Europe, Latin America, Middle East, and North America. Through its worldwide reach, Biblica engages people with God’s Word so that their lives are transformed through a relationship with Jesus Christ. Copyright © 1995, 1996, 1998 by International Bible Society

publishedBibles.derived: Masoretic Text, Nestle-Aland Greek New Testament (based on Westcott-Hort, Weiss and Tischendorf, 1862).

translations.name: New International Version
translations.description: The New International Version (NIV) is a completely original translation of the Bible developed by more than one hundred scholars working from the best available Hebrew, Aramaic, and Greek texts. Copyright © 1973, 1978, 1984, 2011 by Biblica, Inc.

translations.name: New International Version
translations.description: The New International Version (NIV) is a completely original translation of the Bible developed by more than one hundred scholars working from the best available Hebrew, Aramaic, and Greek texts. Copyright © 1973, 1978, 1984, 2011 by Biblica, Inc.

translations.name: New International Version - UK
translations.description: The UK-NIV is indifferentiable from the NIV published in the United States, except for the anglicized spelling and grammar.

translations.name: New International Version - UK
translations.description: The UK-NIV is indifferentiable from the NIV published in the United States, except for the anglicized spelling and grammar.

translations.name: New Living Translation
translations.description: The goal of any Bible translation is to convey the meaning of the ancient Hebrew and Greek texts as accurately as possible to the modern reader. The New Living Translation is based on the most recent scholarship in the theory of translation. The challenge for the translators was to create a text that would make the same impact in the life of modern readers that the original text had for the original readers. In the New Living Translation, this is accomplished by translating entire thoughts (rather than just words) into natural, everyday English. The end result is a translation that is easy to read and understand and that accurately communicates the meaning of the original text. Copyright © 1996, 2004, 2007 by Tyndale House Foundation

translations.name: New Living Translation

In the New Living Translation, this is accomplished by translating entire thoughts (rather than just words) into natural, everyday English. The end result is a translation that is easy to read and understand and that accurately communicates the meaning of the original text. Copyright © 1996, 2004, 2007 by Tyndale House Foundation

translations.name: Today's New International Version
translations.description: Today's New International Version (TNIV) is an English translation of the Bible based on the NIV and published in 2005. Like its predecessor, the NIV, it is explicitly Protestant, which means that the deuterocanonical books are not present. 53 scholars, many of them experts on specific books of the Bible, reviewed the translations teams' work. The translation took more than 10 years to complete and was published by Zondervan and Hodder & Stoughton.

translations.name: Polish Living New Testament
translations.description:
Słowo Życia, or Word of Life,  is a Protestant paraphrase of the New Testament, was created in the evangelical environment , whose premise is to give the message of Jesus Christ in a modern, intelligible language. This is not a classic translation, because due to the far-reaching dynamism, the translators themselves regard it as a paraphrase of the text. It was published in 1989 by the \"Agape\" Publishing Institute. The Word of Life was developed on the basis of an English translation of the Greek language - Living New Testament and parallel translations in various languages made by Living Bible International - a Swedish Bible organization specializing in dynamic translations. Each book is preceded by a short introduction containing a concise collection of information about each book (authorship, place of writing, time of writing, summary and subject matter).

The last paragraph of the preface is defined by the message of the Word of Life:

\"If this translation helps to deepen the deep and often complex thoughts of the Word of God and to better understand and apply the New Testament text, thus deepening the Christian life of its readers and facilitating imitation of the Lord, this book has achieved its goal.\"

translations.description:
The New Romanian Translation ( NTR ) or the New Translation in Romanian ( NTLR ) is a translation of the Bible in Romanian developed by a committee of translators from 1998 to 2006 for the International Bible Society, renamed Biblica, Inc.
The translation was drafted by a Baptist college of Emanuel University in Oradea, coordinated by James L. Courter.

The New Living Bible in Spanish
New International Version
translations.description: In 1979, The International Bible Society (now Biblica®) decided to produce a New Testament in Spanish following the NIV tranlation principles, which they worked on with several people and committees for over ten years. The translation process sought to preserve the original language while taking into account the target language as well. Many original, well-known phrases were kept, but others were introduced to communicate concepts \"that are not so clear in other versions.\" The NVI present on the Bible Gateway matches Biblica's 1999 printing.

translations.name: La Santa Biblia, Nueva Versión Internacional®
New International Version
translations.description: Nueva Versión Internacional: In 1979, the International Bible Society embarked on 10-year project to produce a new Spanish-language New Testament in, using the principles that informed the NIV. The translation process sought to preserve the original language while, at the same time, taking into account the specific needs of the Spanish-speaking world.

translations.name: Nueva Versión Internacional
translations.description: Nueva Versión Internacional: In 1979, the International Bible Society embarked on 10-year project to produce a new Spanish-language New Testament in, using the principles that informed the NIV. The translation process sought to preserve the original language while, at the same time, taking into account the specific needs of the Spanish-speaking world.

translations.name: Swedish New Living Bible
translations.description:
New Testament, New Living Bible is a Swedish translation of an English New Testament, published by the International Bible Society (Biblical Society, now Biblica) in 2003.

The New Testament NLB is distributed in Sweden, among other things. by the Christian youth organization Ny Generation. The earlier edition, the Living Bible, was also a translation from English. The original was written by Kenneth N. Taylor , who would explain the Bible's message for his ten children. There was no Bible translation but a paraphrase or free interpretation.

The aim of the New Testament, New Living Bible was that the basic text should be translated so that the language could also be understood by completely unfamiliar Bible readers, and for example, old words such as \"righteous\", \"grace\" and \"gospel\" were revised. The words have been the same in all Swedish translations since the 16th century. Understandable messages easily understood by the original recipient are printed in the text or in footnotes.

The New Living Bible has been printed in 200,000 copies.

translations.name: Swahili Bible
translations.description: Swahili, or Kiswahili, is a Bantu language spoken by 47,000,000 people in Tanzania. Globally, there are 98,292,010 speakers. The language is mainly spoken in Somalia, Tanzania, Kenya, and Mozambique.
